data.title: National Wikipedia Factbook of Piedmont-Sardinia and Sicily
data.text:
Piedmont-Sardinia & Sicily

The United Kingdom of Piedmont-Sardinia and Sicily commonly called Piedmont or the Romano-Italian Empire, is a constitutional absolute hereditary monarchy and a

unitary representative democracy in southern central Europe. It is bordered on the north by the Kingdom of Belgium, United Kingdom of Great Britain & Ireland, the Swiss Confederation, Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, Russian & German Empires, on the south by the Belgian Congo, French North Africa & British East Africa, by the east by the Russian Empire & British Raj India and on the west by the the Kingdoms of Great Britain, Belgium & the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. Piedmont covers 47,276,615 square kilometers and has has an estimated population of 266 million. Piedmont comprises of 96 provinces that are principalities, duchies, marquisates, counties & baronies and over 50 territories/colonies around the world.

Piedmont-Sardinia and Sicily has the primary role of being a multi-ethnic, European superpower. It has survived continuous world & civil wars for over 3 centuries. Many other European superpowers, failed to realize that in order for an empire to expand you would need, people, resources & money. Piedmont's job is to be the policeman of the world, always making sure that all nations are following the international laws. While being the always vigilant watchman of the world, it's a growing center for arts, sciences,trade, commerce, culture & sophistication. It is the largest world & colonial empire to date in the world, far surpassing the British, Russian, German, Dutch, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Chinese & Japanese Empires in land mass & population. To date, Piedmont is apart of several different organizations, such as the Holy League, Council of Europe, Commonwealth Congress of Colonial Powers, Palermo Pact Congress, Commonwealth of Roman & Latin States & Tehran Conference.

Etymology

Piedmont's name come from medieval Latin with Piedmont coming from Pedemontium, meaning "At the foot of the Mountains" or "Foothills." Sardinia has its origins in a pre-Roman language, which it is likely to have come from the word, "Sardus Pater" meaning "Sardinian Father" or "Father of Sardinia," a Sardinian mythological hero-god, associated with the island. Sicily being the the longest, continuously inhabited region in Piedmont, has a far older origin than the others. Sicily comes from the ancient Greek word, " Σικελία (Sikelia)," meaning "Land of the Sicels." Piedmont's names represent its differing ethnic origins.

The standard way to refer to a citizen of Piedmont is as a "Savoyard, Roman, Italian, Sardinian or Sicilian."
